New Records: The Warriors have now started 10-2 or better six times since the 2014-15 season, joining the Boston Celtics (eight times from 1957-58) and the Milwaukee Bucks (six times from 1970-71 to 1980-81) as the only teams to start 10-2 or better at least six times in an 11-season span
Key Match Events: Buddy Hield led all scorers with 18 points and four 3-pointers
Stephen Curry sank a high arching fadeaway from the baseline with 1.1 second remaining in the first half
Buddy Hield gave a quick jab step before firing and swishing a 28-foot trey over former Defensive Player of the Year Marcus Smart
Draymond Green made a season-high-tying three 3-pointers
Pre-Game Insights: Unfortunately, injured guard De'Anthony Melton missed tonight's game due to a left ACL sprain
Lindy Waters III started in place of injured guard De'Anthony Melton and scored the Warriors' first five points
Post-Match Reflections: The Warriors improved to 4-1 in clutch games this season (score within five points under five minutes)
Tonight marked the Warriors' 523rd consecutive sellout, the third longest active streak in the NBA
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors bench has scored 40-or-more points in 11 of their first 12 games, a franchise first
The Warriors have won 11 of the team's last 13 games vs. Memphis played at home
Others: The Warriors are now 8-1 vs. teams from the Western Conference
The Warriors are now 8-0 when scoring 120-plus points
